headline: Oklo moves higher, American Eagle pulls guidance, Reddit surges
text: Yahoo Finance host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Oklo Inc. (OKLO) posting a narrower-than-expected loss for the nuclear energy developer's first quarter, clothing retailer American Eagle Outfitters (AEO) withdrawing its 2025 guidance, and shares of social media platform Reddit (RDDT) surging ahead in Wednesday's session. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Exploring 3 High Growth Tech Stocks In The US Market
text: As the U.S. stock market experiences a rally, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite showing gains amid easing trade tensions and favorable inflation data, investors are keenly observing high-growth sectors like technology that have been leading these upward trends. In such an environment, identifying tech stocks with strong growth potential can be crucial for investors looking to capitalize on market momentum while navigating the complexities of economic indicators and broader sentiment shifts.

headline: 2 Top Tech Stocks That Could Make You a Millionaire
text: D-Wave Quantum and Reddit have the potential to be significant wealth-building stocks.

headline: 2 Growth Stocks to Buy and Hold for the Long Term
text: Meta Platforms dominates the social media landscape with more than 3.4 billion daily users, yet it still has untapped growth opportunities. Reddit has become an essential platform, used widely by people to get answers to questions on a range of topics, and this is translating to robust demand for advertising space on it. Market volatility comes and goes, but anyone can build a substantial nest egg in the stock market over many years by steadily adding shares of growing businesses to their portfolios, and patiently holding them.

headline: 3 Reasons to Buy Reddit Stock Like There's No Tomorrow
text: Reddit reported first-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street estimates. The social media platform is capitalizing on rapid user growth. An outlook for accelerating profitability supports a bullish outlook for the stock.

headline: Reddit will tighten verification to keep out human-like AI bots
text: Redditors around the world were scandalized last week after learning that a team of researchers released a swarm of AI-powered, human-impersonating bots on the "Change My View" subreddit. The large-scale experiment was designed to explore just how persuasive AI can be. The bots posted over 1,700 comments, adopting personas like abuse survivors or controversial identities like an anti-Black Lives Matter advocate. For Reddit, the incident was a mini-nightmare. Reddit’s brand is associated with aut

headline: Reddit Stock Is a Long-Term Opportunity, Analyst Says
text: Reddit stock was rising Monday after a Seaport Research analyst upgraded shares of the social networking company on confidence in its long-term opportunities. Aaron Kessler upgraded shares of Reddit to Buy from Neutral and gave the stock a $165 price target on Monday, which implies a 45% increase from the stock’s closing price of $113.83 on Friday. “We continue to expect solid long-term user growth and meaningful revenue/monetization growth,” Kessler wrote.

headline: On Semiconductor, Wendy's, Reddit: Trending tickers
text: Here are some of the stocks on the move on Monday, May 5. On Semiconductor (ON) shares slipped after reporting first quarter results. The company's outlook for Q2 adjusted gross margins fell short of expectations. Wendy's (WEN) was upgraded to Overweight at JPMorgan, while Seaport upgraded Reddit (RDDT) to a Buy. Learn more about the calls in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Reddit Just Shocked Wall Street -- And It's Not Done Yet
text: Explosive growth, bold forecasts, and an ad model that's stealing market share from tech giants

headline: Reddit (NYSE:RDDT) Reports US$392 Million Q1 Sales And Projects Up To US$430 Million Revenue
text: Reddit (NYSE:RDDT) recently reported its first-quarter 2025 earnings, displaying a remarkable turnaround from losses to a positive net income of USD 26 million, alongside significant revenue growth. These impressive financial results, coupled with a favorable revenue guidance for the next quarter, align with a positive market sentiment and stronger-than-expected U.S. jobs data. During the past month, Reddit's stock price increased by 8%, in sync with broader market trends such as the S&P...

headline: Why Reddit Stock’s Huge Earnings Gain Didn’t Last
text: Reddit stock initially shot up after the company’s quarterly earnings beat analysts’ expectations, but had erased those gains by Friday afternoon. “Our unique advantage is that people come to Reddit with intent—they’re not just scrolling, they’re also seeking,” CEO Steve Huffman wrote in a shareholder letter along with earnings results. “They come to Reddit for real opinions from real people.”

headline: Reddit 'Well Positioned' to Grow in $250 Billion Digital Ad Market, Oppenheimer Says
text: Reddit (RDDT) is "well positioned" to keep expanding its presence in the roughly $250 billion digita

headline: Reddit Sees Surge in Revenue, Expands Access Globally
text: Reddit Inc. shares jumped after it said revenue in the current quarter will be better than estimates, a sign that a broader dip in the economy hasn't yet dented the digital advertising industry. The web forum company says its adding more advertisers and expanding access. Jennifer Wong, Reddit's chief operating officer, speaks to Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow.

headline: Bernstein upgrades Reddit, says it’s ’executing under the cloud of unknowns’
text: Investing.com -- Bernstein upgraded Reddit to Market-Perform from Underperform in a note this week, pointing to strong execution despite lingering uncertainties around user growth and platform monetization. The firm also raised its price target for the stock to $130 from $110.

headline: Reddit is one of tech's most surprising winners
text: Reddit may not have the scale of Meta (META), Google (GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), or even Snap (SNAP). But its first-quarter earnings, released Thursday after the bell, confirm it’s one of the most surprising winners of the post-AI attention economy.

headline: Apple downgraded, Reddit upgraded: Wall Street's top analyst calls
text: Apple downgraded, Reddit upgraded: Wall Street's top analyst calls

headline: Nvidia AI boost, Block cuts outlook, Reddit surges on sales
text: Nvidia (NVDA) shares are getting a boost after reports from The Information indicate that the semiconductor manufacturer may be planning to tailor its chips for exporting to China. Additionally, other tech giants are expecting to up their investments into AI infrastructure. Block (XYZ) stock is plummeting this morning after cutting its profit outlook. Social media platform Reddit (RDDT) is rising in Friday's pre-market after seeing a profit in its first quarter. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Reddit stock slides as investors weigh Google Search traffic, user growth concerns
text: Reddit stock tumbled Friday despite a first quarter earnings beat as investors worried about the company's daily active user growth and changes to Google's Search algorithm.
